import numpy as np

# (X has a winning line)
# Usefulness: This feature directly identifies if player 'x' has a three-in-a-row configuration, which is the definition of "win for x" according to the dataset description. It captures the target concept's essence, making it highly predictive for classifying the 'Class' label. This directly models whether a board configuration results in a positive outcome for 'x'. We assume that the integer `2` represents player 'x', which is a common encoding for categorical features {x, o, b} where 'b' (blank) is 0, 'o' (player o) is 1, and 'x' (player x) is 2, often following alphabetical order for the latter two if 'b' is separated.
# Input samples: 'top-left-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(0), np.int64(2)], 'top-middle-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(1), np.int64(2)], 'top-right-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(2), np.int64(2)], 'middle-left-square': [np.int64(0), np.int64(0), np.int64(0)], 'middle-middle-square': [np.int64(2), np.int64(2), np.int64(1)], 'middle-right-square': [np.int64(1), np.int64(0), np.int64(1)], 'bottom-left-square': [np.int64(0), np.int64(1), np.int64(0)], 'bottom-middle-square': [np.int64(0), np.int64(2), np.int64(1)], 'bottom-right-square': [np.int64(0), np.int64(1), np.int64(0)]
df['x_has_winning_line'] = (
    ((df['top-left-square'] == 2) & (df['top-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['top-right-square'] == 2)) |  # Row 1
    ((df['middle-left-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-right-square'] == 2)) |  # Row 2
    ((df['bottom-left-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-right-square'] == 2)) |  # Row 3
    ((df['top-left-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-left-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-left-square'] == 2)) |  # Col 1
    ((df['top-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-middle-square'] == 2)) |  # Col 2
    ((df['top-right-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-right-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-right-square'] == 2)) |  # Col 3
    ((df['top-left-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-right-square'] == 2)) |  # Diag 1
    ((df['top-right-square'] == 2) & (df['middle-middle-square'] == 2) & (df['bottom-left-square'] == 2))    # Diag 2
).astype(int)
